segment.source: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.
segment.target: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.

segment.source: DISM Capabilities Package Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Capabilities Package Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: DISM Capabilities Package Servicing Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Capabilities Package Servicing Command-Line Options

segment.source: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.
segment.target: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.

segment.source: Use Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) to service Windows capabilities.
segment.target: Use Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM.exe) to service Windows capabilities.

segment.source: Capabilities are a Windows package type allows you to request services like .NET or languages without specifying the version.
segment.target: Capabilities are a Windows package type allows you to request services like .NET or languages without specifying the version.

segment.source: Use DISM to search multiple sources like Windows Update or your corporate servers to find and install the latest version.
segment.target: Use DISM to search multiple sources like Windows Update or your corporate servers to find and install the latest version.

segment.source: To see the available capabilities, go to Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).
segment.target: To see the available capabilities, go to Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).

segment.source: DISM Command-Line Options
segment.target: DISM Command-Line Options

segment.source: Here's how each DISM option can be used.
segment.target: Here's how each DISM option can be used.

segment.source: These options are not case sensitive.
segment.target: These options are not case sensitive.

segment.source: Note, each of these commands requires either the /Online or /Image:pathtoofflineimagefile argument.
segment.target: Note, each of these commands requires either the /Online or /Image:pathtoofflineimagefile argument.

segment.source: Options
segment.target: Options

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: /Add-Capability
segment.target: /Add-Capability

segment.source: /Name:capability_name[/Source:source] [/LimitAccess]
segment.target: /Name:capability_name[/Source:source] [/LimitAccess]

segment.source: Adds a capability to an image.
segment.target: Adds a capability to an image.

segment.source: Note DISM checks for the source files in the following order:
segment.target: Note DISM checks for the source files in the following order:

segment.source: If /Source is specified, DISM looks in the specified locations first.
segment.target: If /Source is specified, DISM looks in the specified locations first.

segment.source: If /Source is not specified, or if the source files are not found in the specified locations, DISM checks to see if a group policy is set.
segment.target: If /Source is not specified, or if the source files are not found in the specified locations, DISM checks to see if a group policy is set.

segment.source: If it is, DISM checks the locations specified by the group policy.
segment.target: If it is, DISM checks the locations specified by the group policy.

segment.source: If the files still aren't found, and if DISM is working against an online image, and if /LimitAccess is not specified, it looks for the files on Windows Update.
segment.target: If the files still aren't found, and if DISM is working against an online image, and if /LimitAccess is not specified, it looks for the files on Windows Update.

segment.source: /Source: Allows you to choose a location, such as a server, where the capability source files are located.
segment.target: /Source: Allows you to choose a location, such as a server, where the capability source files are located.

segment.source: You can use multiple /Source arguments.
segment.target: You can use multiple /Source arguments.

segment.source: /LimitAccess: Tells DISM to not check Windows Update or Windows Server Update Services for the capability source files.
segment.target: /LimitAccess: Tells DISM to not check Windows Update or Windows Server Update Services for the capability source files.

segment.source: /Get-Capabilities
segment.target: /Get-Capabilities

segment.source: Get capabilities in the image.
segment.target: Get capabilities in the image.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Get-CapabilityInfo/CapabilityName:capability_name
segment.target: /Get-CapabilityInfo/CapabilityName:capability_name

segment.source: Get information about a specific capability.
segment.target: Get information about a specific capability.

segment.source: Example:
segment.target: Example:

segment.source: /Remove-Capability
segment.target: /Remove-Capability

segment.source: Additional argument required:
segment.target: Additional argument required:

segment.source: /CapabilityName:capability_name_in_image
segment.target: /CapabilityName:capability_name_in_image
